radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is of normal size and normal signal intensity. Gallbladder is full of stones with a thickened wall. No evidence of significant pericholecystic hepatic enhancement. No intrahepatic bile duct dilatation. CBD is not dilated. Anatomic variant with an aberrant right posterior duct draining into the common hepatic duct. Pancreas is of normal size and intensity without peripancreatic edema. Mucosal enhancement and small amount of periduodenal edema around the second and third portion of the duodenum. Appearance of adrenals, spleen, kidneys is unremarkable. No evidence of retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. No free fluid in the abdomen.
